Description: Rim sherd of Attic, probably black-figured, pottery Siana cup with turn to bowl; interior reserved band at rim, glazed black below; top of lip glazed; exterior: ivy leaf chain with alternating added red and black leaves.
Producer name: Attributed to the Workshop of: The C Painter (possibly)
Curator's comments: Note the mistake where two lines connect the upper left leaf with central horizontal line. For parallels, see Brijder, H. A. G., Siana Cups I and Komast Cups. Amsterdam 1983, pl. 60i and 174, fig. 56c-d. According to Brijder the ivy decoration is similar to that on double-decker Siana cups, which are familiar to the C Painter's workshop (Brijder 1983, 214).
Bibliographic references: Brijder 1983a / Siana Cups I and Komast Cups (p. 265; pl. 60h; no. 305)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 230, no. 9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0380) (Phase 1)
